perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall forfeit the Guarantee paid to date of ***** dollars (US$*****), and shall immediately pay the remaining Guarantee of ***** dollars (US$*****), equaling a total Guarantee payment by Licensee to Fox of ***** dollars (US$*****) ("Guarantee Forfeiture Payment"). The Guarantee Forfeiture Payment may be recouped from Licensee's sales of the IN HER SHOES Wireless Product and the IDIOCRACY Wireless Product, as set forth in Paragraphs 2(a)(ii) and 2(b)(i) of this Amendment.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall forfeit the Guarantee paid to date of ***** dollars (US$*****), and shall immediately pay the remaining Guarantee of ***** dollars (US$*****), equaling a total Guarantee payment by Licensee to Fox of ***** dollars (US$*****) ("Guarantee Forfeiture Payment"). The Guarantee Forfeiture Payment may be recouped from Licensee's sales of the IN HER SHOES Wireless Product and the IDIOCRACY Wireless Product, as set forth in Paragraphs 2(a)(ii) and 2(b)(i) of this Amendment. Notwithstanding the above, the Guarantee Forfeiture Payment is non-refundable and cannot be recouped under any circumstances.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating in one sentence that the Guarantee Forfeiture Payment can be recouped, and in the next sentence stating that it cannot be recouped under any circumstances, creating uncertainty and conflicting obligations.

perturbation.original_text: After Fox or its assigns deducts its Distribution Fee, it shall remit the remainder to Licensee and Licensee shall pay to Fox or its assigns or such other party as Fox or its assigns may designate in writing, Royalties in the amounts set forth in the Agreement or this Amendment.
perturbation.changed_text: After Fox or its assigns deducts its Distribution Fee, it shall remit the remainder to Licensee and Licensee shall pay to Fox or its assigns or such other party as Fox or its assigns may designate in writing, Royalties in the amounts set forth in the Agreement or this Amendment. However, Licensee is not obligated to pay any Royalties for the first year of distribution.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict regarding the obligation to pay royalties. The original text states that Licensee 'shall pay' royalties. The added sentence contradicts this by stating Licensee is not obligated to pay royalties for the first year, causing confusion about the actual payment terms.

perturbation.original_text: With the exception of Licensee's Royalties payment obligations with respect to all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment, and the obligations set forth in this Amendment, neither party shall have any further obligation under the Agreement, and all claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released.
perturbation.changed_text: With the exception of Licensee's Royalties payment obligations with respect to all Wireless Products released as of the date of this Amendment, and the obligations set forth in this Amendment, neither party shall have any further obligation under the Agreement, and all claims arising under the Agreement shall be mutually released. This release does not include claims related to intellectual property infringement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that 'all claims arising under the agreement shall be mutually released'. The modified text adds a contradictory statement that the release 'does not include claims related to intellectual property infringement.' This creates uncertainty and conflicts on the scope of the mutual release.
